page.title: 11Marldon Footpaths
page.content: Marldon has many footpaths and 'green lanes'. Being near Torquay and Paignton most of them are well used by walkers, horse riders and motor cyclists who like rough riding. They are specially pleasant in the spring with the primroses. One footpath starts on the ring road and then goes to Stantor and on to Cockington. Another, with good views, goes from Compton Castle to Style Park Nurseries. Well used by horse riders is the one from Wrigwell in the n.w. of our block, top the Marldon-Ipplepen road, and then along a green lane called Aptor Lane. You can follw this all the way to Berry Pomeroy castle. You can walk up to Beacon Hill, where the T.V. and police radio masts are. The Beacon was used for an alarm fire in the times of Elizabeth 1.
